title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.11.35 | 24-07-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Mirandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya
Chakshurunmilitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshthaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhaktivedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatyade Shatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravatta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
Naram Chai Vanarottamam Deveem Saraswateem
Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 35th verse of the 11th chapter of the 1st
canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
Saesha Naralokesmin Avatirina Swamayaya
Ramesh Sri Ratnakootastho Bhagavan Prakruto Yatha
The meaning of this 35th verse is
That Supreme Personality of Godhead Sri Krishna
out of his causeless mercy appeared on this planet
by its internal potency and enjoyed himself amongst
competent women as if he were engaging in mundane
affairs.
Here is a warning given by Suta Goswami

So he remains unknown to all materially conditioned souls.
Though when he incarnates, they are able to see him.
But that seeing is not the spiritual vision
by which they can see the spiritual form
and understand the spiritual nature of the Lord.
They cannot.
They think he is another person of this world.
But that is completely wrong understanding.
When the Lord appears on different lokas or planets
or on this planet of human beings,
he displays his transcendental pastimes
just to attract the conditioned souls
to become his eternal servitors, friends, parents and lovers
respectively in the transcendental world.
Each one of us, we have got a relationship with Krishna,
relationship of pureness,
pure love, spiritual love.
Now love is a word not to be mistaken with
loving relationships in this material world.
Material world or relationships are based on the body,
on matter, on material qualities.
A relationship with the Lord is based completely on spiritual attributes.
The Lord is completely spiritual.
We are also pure spirit souls.
Irtundas.
So when we become purified of all material contamination,
then our actual spiritual form,
spiritual identity is revealed.
And in that spiritual identity,
we can approach the Lord
and actually reestablish the forgotten relationship,
the spiritual relationship of spiritual love.
That is what is being described here.
In the spiritual world,
the Lord eternally reciprocates such exchanges of service.
He's got millions and billions of devotees in his personal abode.
And he's constantly engaged in pastimes with them.
Everything else is taken care by Krishna's own Yogamaya potency.
In the spiritual world, nobody has to work.
Nobody has to do anything to maintain themselves.
They're simply engaged in a devotional service of Krishna.
And they are enjoying rendering such service
because the Lord reciprocates.
And then they experience ecstasy.
That will be explained in great detail in the 10th canto.
Here just a mention is being made because Krishna has reached Dwaraka.
So when he comes to this world,
the Lord displays his pastimes which are going on in the spiritual world.
And he wants to attract us.
You can also enjoy with me like all these devotees of mine are enjoying with me.
That's what Krishna's message is.
But foolishly, people think that Krishna is an ordinary person.
And if he can enjoy with so many women,
why can't I enjoy?
This is a foolishness.
This is a foolishness of materialistic people
who fail to understand the real nature of Krishna's personality
which is revealed in the Bhagavatam and the Bhagavad Gita
and all the Vedic scriptures.
It is clearly revealed.
Now as regards service in the material world,
Prabhupada says,
service is pervertedly represented in the material world
and broken untimely,
resulting in sad experiences.
We may establish a nice relationship with another person of this world,
but it is broken when the body is finished.
This body, material body is temporary.
And the relationship lasts only as long as the body is there.
When the body is finished, relationship is finished.
The illusion living being conditioned by material nature,
cannot understand out of ignorance
that all our relations here in the mundane world
are temporary and full of inebriates.
Inebriate means defects.
Everything here is defective.
Material relationships are defective.
And they are also temporary.
They don't last because the body itself is temporary.
So relationships based on body will be temporary.
And it is temporary.
It is a state of ignorance.
As long as we are materially conditioned,
we are in ignorance
that we cannot understand the effect of the illusion.
We think whatever we are perceiving is reality.
Material presentation by maya,
we consider that as permanent, as eternal.
It is actually temporal.
And it is based on the fact that we are in a state of ignorance.
And it is based on the actions and reactions of the three gunas.
It is not a factual reality.
What is presented, what appears like real but is not real.
Such relations means, these material relations,
cannot help us be happy perpetually.
Some temporary happiness may be there
in such material relations.
But it cannot give us permanent happiness.
If the same relation is established with the Lord,
then we are transferred to the transcendental world
after leaving this material body.
This is explained in the Bhagavad Gita.
This is explained in the Bhagavad Gita.
If we establish our relationship with Krishna,
then we,
